page.title: 09URBAN WEST CORNFORTH
page.content:
The village is devided by the limits of the D-Block,and much of the industry has gone with it.
About 100 years ago Cornforth had a thriving Pit which employed over 2,000 men. The Colliery was run down and employment was found in the quarries which surround the village. The quarry stone is magnesium limestone which is used in steel making,and as aggragele for Motorways. The main quarry is owned by Steetley.
The orginal village was based upon the Green,a group of houses around a small grassed area with a road through the middle.
It is now the most popular place in the village,and because the main road goes around it,the Green is also very
